Experience

Motswari Game Lodge lies in the Timbavati Reserve, part of the Greater Kruger National Park Conservancy & is home to Africa’s Big 5.
This area is popular for its frequent Big 5 sightings as well as the elusive wild dog & cheetah.

Stay

Motswari Game Lodge consists of 15 luxury bungalows (inclusive of 2 sets of inter-leading rooms), accommodating a maximum of 30 guests. Each bungalow features an en-suite bathroom & magnificent bush or river views.
Giraffe’s Nest Hide, a highlight at Motswari, is an exclusive & private overnight bush experience overlooking the Xanatsi dam. The hide sleeps 2 guests & is the perfect choice for those looking for an authentic overnight bush experience.
The main area at Motswari features a lounge, dining room, open-air boma, swimming pool & art gallery selling local artworks made from wood, bone & stone.

Activities

There is never a dull moment at Motswari. Twice daily game drives in open 4x4 vehicles will ensure close encounters with South Africa’s wildlife, including the Big 5 & general game like giraffe, zebra, impala & a wide variety of birds.
Guests can also enjoy relaxing treatments at the Mobile Spa. Local artworks are on display throughout the lodge & can be purchased at an additional cost.

subfolders.title: Kings Camp
subfolders.description: The exceptional Kings Camp is situated in a quiet corner of the famous Timbavati Reserve, adjacent to the Kruger National Park in South Africa. Kings Camp reflects something of a romantic, colonial Africa & faces an open savanna plain with a waterhole, which is visited by a wide variety of animals.

subfolders.title: Makanyi Lodge
subfolders.description: Makanyi Lodge is a private safari haven in the heart of the Timbavati Game Reserve in the Greater Kruger region. The lodge overlooks a permanent waterhole & is frequented by animals daily – so guests can sit on the deck while watching them drink or play in the water below.

subfolders.title: Ngala Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Set in the heart of the Timbavati Reserve in South Africa’s Greater Kruger region, Ngala provides guests with an extraordinary Big 5 safari experience. Ngala features 2 unique safari lodges - Ngala Safari Lodge & Ngala Tented Camp.  Ngala Safari Lodge is a great option for families & Ngala Tented Camp is ideal for couples or honeymooners.

subfolders.title: Rock Fig Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Rock Fig Safari Lodge is a relaxed, but luxurious lodge located within the world-renowned Timbavati Reserve in the Greater Kruger. Rock Fig is the perfect bush destination for families with children of all ages, or a group of friends.  Since the lodge is small & intimate (only 6 suites), it can be booked out on an exclusive use basis, so guests are ensured a private safari experience.

subfolders.title: Simbavati Hilltop Lodge
subfolders.description: The Simbavati Lodges are located within the heart of the Timbavati Game Reserve in the Greater Kruger region & offers phenomenal Big 5 wildlife viewing. There are 2 lodges at Simbavati – one is located on a hill - Simbavati Hilltop Lodge, & the other is located by a river - Simbavati River Lodge.

subfolders.title: Tanda Tula Field Camp
subfolders.description: The Tanda Tula Camps are set within the game-packed private Timbavati Nature Reserve in the Greater Kruger Region & is home to the Big 5 – lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo & rhino. Tanda Tula in the Timbavati features 4 camps – Tanda Tula Safari Camp, Tanda Tula Field Camp, Tanda Tula Plains Camp & Tanda Tula Nkarhi Homestead.
